meanings.definition: Loyalty to a particular social group, often leading to prejudice or discrimination against others.
meanings.sent1: His tribalisms towards his favorite sports team never wavered, no matter the outcome.
meanings.sent2: The tribalisms within the political party caused division among its members.
meanings.sent3: The tribalisms in the classroom were evident during the spirited debate about the best school lunch.
